best_gem_comment: This class has the potential to be great, I think under normal years when Professor Stavins is teaching it it would be way better than with Elizabeth Meatal. She moved way too fast and wasn't the best teacher where as the one lecture he came in for (he was on sabbatical) I felt like I learned so much more and he was way more engaging. The week to week coursework wasn't hard, and the class could've been gem–y if not for the midterm, which apparently was way harder then past years.
best_gem_comment_short: The week to week coursework wasn't hard, and the class could've been gem–y if not for the midterm, which apparently was way harder then past years.

best_gem_comment: Off–cycle ec10a is much better than the regular fall class. The class is much smaller (100 people), there are fewer assignments, and Anne is super nice. The tests, including the final, are also virtual and open note.  Finally, don’t be afraid that the tests may initially seem hard: the average was ~70% for each of our tests but Anne said that they would be curved. A definite gem.

Gem elective class and is good because it is quantitative without being extremely hard; definitely will help you see if you like the quantitative side of economics on an intro level; my advice is to take this class as an elective if you are a Stat or AM concentrator because it definitely on the better side of electives for those concentrations.
best_gem_comment_short: Gem elective class and is good because it is quantitative without being extremely hard; definitely will help you see if you like the quantitative side of economics on an intro level; my advice is to take this class as an elective if you are a Stat or AM concentrator because it definitely on the better side of electives for those concentrations.
